studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Discontinuation of Blinded Independent Central Review (BICR) for disease progression assessment after final PFS analysis.
Discontinuation of immune-related response criteria (irRECIST) data collection.
Introduction of a specific laboratory test schedule for the period following the IA3 cut-off date (28-Apr-2020).
Updated safety monitoring requirements including MUGA/Echocardiogram and cardiac biomarkers (BNP, troponin, CK-MB) due to myocarditis cases.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Final PFS analyses specified in the protocol have been performed, allowing transition to investigator-assessed progression.
Occurrence of myocarditis cases in early phases of treatment necessitated enhanced cardiac monitoring guidelines.
PACL dated 02 September 2019 mandated the cessation of irRECIST-defined antitumor activity collection.

studyChanges.beforeText: Confirmed disease progression by BICR assessment
studyChanges.afterText: After review of images by BICR is stopped... permanent discontinuation of treatment will be performed as per investigator-assessed disease progression.
studyChanges.summary: Transitioned progression assessment from BICR to investigator assessment following final PFS analysis.

studyChanges.beforeText: irRECIST-defined antitumor activity will be collected
studyChanges.afterText: irRECIST-defined antitumor activity will no longer be collected as per PACL dated 02 September 2019.
Required Laboratory Tests Post IA3 Cut Off Date (28-Apr-2020)
studyChanges.summary: Added a new table for laboratory requirements specific to the post-IA3 study phase.

studyChanges.afterText: The study plans to monitor patients at regular intervals... including MUGA/Echocardiogram, ECG, BNP, troponin and CK-MB monitoring.
studyChanges.summary: Added intensive cardiac monitoring and myocarditis management instructions.
